label: Description
value: Yellow silk satin with brocaded design in violet, pink and silver, showing two parallel flowering vines with serpentine stems.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: 8-harness satin weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1976:  Cora Ginsburg collection; 1976: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Straight repeat: brick arrangement of 4 medallions containing romantic scenes with cupid printed in purple. A red floral vine frames the medallions on yellow background. The red and yellow were originally vey bright. repeat: 47 cm. (18 1/2") high x 84 cm. (33") wide.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 61 x 125 cm (24 in. x 49 3/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Half-drop repeat of a group of very full blossoms superimposed on a scrolling vine on a brown ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: roller and block printed

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 214.5 × 63 cm (7 ft. 7/16 in. × 24 13/16 in.) Repeat H x W (minimum pattern unit): 35.5 × 35.5 cm (14 × 14 in.)

label: Description
value: Brick repeat of dovetailed rows of a white flowering plant on a blue ground. The motif in alternate rows is counterfaced.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: two plain weave structures interconnected in areas

label: Description
value: Fragment of russet damask weave silk brocaded in silver with yellow and white silk, showing floral design in the ‘bizarre’ style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: damask weave with supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Octagon and diamond grid covering entire surface of half a quilt. Each diamond contains a four-legged animal: one with large antlers, another with a bird perched on its back. Each octagon has an eight-pointed star containing fantastic animals of various types with wings, antlers, tails; some are four-legged and others are bird-like. Weft-loop fringe on three sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, cotton Technique: trapunto (two layers of plain weave, pattern outlined in back stitch, pattern shapes stuffed with unspun cotton or heavy cotton cord, background areas textured by running stitches which also hold two layers together

label: Description
value: Vertically symmetrical formal floral pattern of broad curling leaves and flowers in light green on a light yellow ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: two interconnected plain weave structures

label: Description
value: Half-drop repeat of two vertical twisting and curving ribbons with flowers attached in purple on a tan background. Fabric lengths placed side by side would have continued pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Techinque: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 198 x 71 cm (6 ft. 5 15/16 in. x 27 15/16 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 198 x 71 cm (6 ft. 5 15/16 in. x 27 15/16 in.) Warp x Weft (c): 198 x 71 cm (6 ft. 5 15/16 in. x 27 15/16 in.) Repeat H x W (minimum unit of repeat): 42 × 34.5 cm (16 9/16 × 13 9/16 in.)

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, cotton and wool Technique: discontinuous supplementary wefts in a plain weave foundation (brocading)

label: Description
value: Three fragments of embroidered upholstery fabric in a multicolored zigzag pattern (flame stitch).

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: counted stitch embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Collection of different designs, each shown in multiple colorway. Patterns for living rooms, halls, dining rooms and bedrooms. Many are shown with matching top and bottom cut-out borders. Some have attached fabric swatch. The samples are arranged with the more expensive in the front of the book.

label: Description
value:
179 pages (incl. top borders; not. incl. attached lower borders or fabric swatches)
Tapestry, landscape, ingrain and oatmeal papers, many tone on tone. Some sidewalls have matching top and bottom borders. Some have tiffany grounds and flitter borders. High-relief cut out borders as well as cut out borders. Some sidewalls are embossed and/or printed to simulate leather. Some have matching fabric swatch attached. Some borders have the appearance of airbrushing. Some sidewalls appear to be intaglio printed. Floral stripe designs for bedrooms and grape designs for dining rooms. Simulated burlap or grasscloth paper.

label: Description
value: Apricot damask weave silk brocaded with metallic yarns and pink, blue and yellow silk showing design of florals in the ‘bizarre’ style. Bold curving pattern has side-by-side repeating floral vines. Both selvages present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: damask weave fragment with 5-harness satin, discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade) bound on front in ¼ twill

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1976: Mrs. Edward Armstrong collection; 1976: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Four sidewall layers removed from parlor wall, Creedmoor Farm.  Top layer is very abraded, with three vertical pilaster stripes.

label: Provenance
value: From Creedmoor Farm, Floral Park, New York.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Colonial Restoration Society of Bellerose Creedmoor Farm

label: Description
value: Very dense vining floral pattern, containing pomegranate-like flowers. Printed in red, green and brown on beige ground.

label: Provenance
value: Four sidewall layers removed from parlor wall, Creedmoor Farm

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Colonial Restoration Society of Bellerose Creedmoor Farm

label: Description
value: Sidewall paper in the Aesthetic style, with all-over patterning of leaves and flowers, printed in gold and off-white, with heavy outlines, on off-white ground. The border is a stylized floral design, possibly printed in an Indian style, printed in browns on off-white.

label: Provenance
value: Removed from parlor wall (Northwall) Creedmore Farm, Floral Park, New York.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Colonial Farmhouse Restoration Society of Bellerose Creedmoor Farm

label: Description
value: Vertical stripes of garland, leaves and lavender flowers.

label: Description
value: Large medallion design in burgundy, pale yellow, terracotta, beige and dark blue with gold outline on graduated green background.

label: Provenance
value: From the Hotel de Paris, Georgetown, Colorado.

label: Description
value: Fleur-de-lys motif set within large foliate medallion. Also acanthus scrolls. Printed in pink, green, deep red and light yellow on background that shades from yellow to brown.

label: Provenance
value: From Hotel de Paris, Georgetown, CO.

label: Description
value: Green and white roses in elaborate floral cartouche. Printed on graduated green ground.

label: Provenance
value: From the Hotel de Paris, Georgetown, Colorado.

label: Description
value: Cylindrical vase with narrow neck, wide circular mouth, and slightly tappered base; overall decoration showing several large red carp swimming on a blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: Stanley Siegel Collection; 1976: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift from the Collection of Stanley Siegel

label: Description
value: Fragments of woven fabric which was probably patterned by two offset interlocked rows of vertically symmetrical ogee – the same ogee in each row. The ogee is formed by leaves ending in a leaf finial at the top and a leaf pendant at bottom. The ogee encloses a floral motif.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: two interconnected structures of 5-harness satin (blue) plus 1/2 twill (yellow)

label: Description
value: Aesthetic-style design. Central motif of red flowers growing on plant. Design is enframed by squares, with flowers extending beyond lines of square. Bands of blue circular motif run along both top and bottom edges. Metallic gold background. Printed on an embossed paper simulating textile weave.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William B. Eldredge

label: Description
value: Aesthetic-style design, all-over floral and foliette pattern, printed in pink, blue, tan and white, with fine gold outline. Groups of flowers coming out of basket-like containers. Printed on embossed ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William B. Eldredge

label: Description
value: Aesthetic style design. Large-scale stylized floral medallion, printed in metallic gold and burgundy on a yellow ocher ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William B. Eldredge

label: Description
value: Aesthetic or Anglo-Japanesque style design. Very stylized and flat floral motifs. Printed two across. Printed in metallic green, copper and gold on a taupe ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William B. Eldredge

label: Description
value: Anglo-Japanesque design with stylized floral motifs and vining foliage  intertwined with a geometric framework. Printed in metallic colors on tan ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William B. Eldredge

value: Gift of Mrs. William B. Eldredge

value: Aesthetic-style design.  All-over foliate and floral motif. Printed in metallic colors on bright gold ground.
